definition: to fight with all one's might

sentences.english: Till you have battled with great grief and fears.
sentences.chinese: 除非你力战过悲伤与恐惧。

sentences.english: And that means the Addicks have all to play for according to Pardew, starting at Ewood Park next weekend.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着查尔顿将在下周的比赛中力战布莱克本队。

sentences.english: After a strange sad war, great war for thee.
sentences.chinese: 为你经过一场奇怪而惨烈的力战。

sentences.english: And that day he was slain, fighting by Henry's side.
sentences.chinese: 他当天就在亨利身边力战阵亡。

definition: the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
to be defeated on the battlefield/to be beaten in a contest
the multitude against the few, a wide disparity (idiom from Mencius); heavily outnumbered/unequally matched/overwhelmed by weight of numbers
multitude of enemies, few friends (idiom from Mencius)/heavily outnumbered/beaten by the weight of numbers
a blood soaked and hard-fought struggle (idiom)
